data.title: Anna Lee
data.meta_description: DURING a film and television career spanning eight decades, Anna Lee appeared in “quota quickies” in England, made an impact in Hollywood, in the Oscar-winner How Green Was My Valley in 1941, played a
data.text:
DURING a film and television career spanning eight decades, Anna Lee appeared in “quota quickies” in England, made an impact in Hollywood, in the Oscar-winner How Green Was My Valley in 1941, played a singing nun in The Sound of Music and was a regular on the American soap opera General Hospital for a quarter of a century, most of which she spent in a wheelchair after a real-life car crash.

Blonde, blue-eyed and with delicate English features, she had been a regular co-star of John Wayne and was described by a film magazine in 1943 as “England in America”. She ran up the Union Jack every morning at her cottage in Hollywood, invited fellow expats for high tea, and appeared as Britannia in a
